messages.subject: RE: just a few words--enenim
messages.msgSnippet: ... great ... are ... really deep ... Just popping out of lurkdom to agree, I don t know anything about Emenim, but I do know Brian Warner and how people (my
messages.messageBody:
> I will say that
>he writes about what he knows, he has made a market for himself, and is

>learning along the way. (His music reflects that learning) He tells a
great
>story through his music, and if you can get past the language, (there
are
>censored/clean copies of his music available, you don't have to buy the

>original version!) and know a little about his life, his music is
really deep
>and moving. All this, and I am not really a big rap fan! <g>

Just popping out of lurkdom to agree, I don't know anything about
Emenim, but I do know Brian Warner and how people (my mom was one of
them until I introduced her to him) can't get past the appearance or the
choice of language he tends to use. If people could see that the choice
of language (in a lot of cases I know of personally, others I can't
comment on) is a message itself. Saying things like "you will only
listen if i talk like this" or "you aren't going to take me seriously no
matter what i do, so shock value will at least make you take notice of
this situation" or "i use this to put up a barrier between me and
everyone who has hurt me" or just "you and people like you piss me off".

Now I know I am getting up there (just 27 years old, but in the music
business that's almost over the hill! LOL), and I know that most of the
MTV stuff I have no idea about (since we don't even have television) but
I do know music of rebellion and--to the woman who had concerns about
her sons language in his music writing--I know what's its like to be
ostracized. IMO your son is reacting normally and you are doing a great
job in keeping the line of communication open. If my mom hadn't done
the same for me, if she had refused to let me explore my own boundaries,
then I would have felt the need to hide things from her and who knows
where that would have led! Your doing great man (I mean, mom), rock on.

namaste,
branwyn

brian warner = marilyn manson
